page.title: 14Farming in Stickney.
page.content: We visited two different farms in our area.The first farm was a family farm, owned by Mr. Hooton.Until 60 years ago there where no tractors in the area, and then there were only very few of them.Mr Hootons father bought his first tractor about 60 years ago. Before that horses were used to plough the field.Mr Hooton still has alot of the old machinery on his farm,but he doesn't use it.It is a fairly small farm of about 40 acres.A quarter of his farm is grass and three quarters of it is arable.The only animals he keeps are cows but he only has eleven of them.He has a 36 foot sprayer and it holds 90 gallons of chemical .The second farm we visted was the farming company.They are a more modern farm than Mr Hooton.It is a far larger farm than Mr Hootons as it has 1300 acres.
